Title: PrivacyEngine and NINJIO Partner to Provide its internationally recognised cybersecurity training solutions for Data Privacy Professionals
Details:
Media Contact
Colm Kelly 
colm.kelly@privacyengine.io
Dublin, Ireland – 02/02/2021: Data protection software and solutions developer PrivacyEngine (formerly Sytorus), has added new cybersecurity awareness training courses to it’s extensive training portfolio in 2021. This training delivered in partnership with NINJIO, empowers individuals and organisations to become defenders against cyberthreats.
The training is delivered online through PrivacyEngine‘s Data Privacy Platform and covers the following areas:

Real life security breaches suffered by companies
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) 
The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) 
The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) 

The courses offer users all the training that they need to ensure they and their organisations are safe from cyberthreats, which in recent times have grown! They include 3-4-minute fun and interactive training videos, which include in depth coverage of the legal foundations and operational requirements in GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA and PCI DSS regulations that has influenced data protection/ cybersecurity practice across the globe.
“Both staff awareness training and production are foundational to the delivery of high quality data privacy management. We already offer a strong portfolio of training content, delivered in the PrivacyEngine Learning Management System, and we are delighted to be able to add the engaging 3 to 4-minute Hollywood-style micro-learning videos from NINJIO to the portfolio ” said John Ghent, CEO PrivacyEngine. 
“We are delighted to be partnering with PrivacyEngine in order to offer all their Data Privacy Platform users the chance to use our fun and engaging cybersecurity training content. We serve some of the largest companies in the world and have changed the behavior of hundreds of thousands of people through engaging, emotionally-driven storytelling. Cybersecurity and data protection threats have been on the rise in recent times, so its crucial that everyone is up to speed on the latest developments” said Antony Semaan, Account Manager, Rain Networks
